description: Number of nonprimes (1 and composites) in the reduced residue system of n-th primorial number (A002110).
example: n=3, 3rd primorial is 30, EulerPhi(30)=8, a(3)=1 since 1 is regarded here a nonprime. See A048597. n=4, 4th primorial is 210, size of its reduced residue system(RRS) is 48 of 6 is either composite or 1: {1,121,143,169,187,209}.
author: _Labos Elemer_
extensions: a(0) prepended, a(15) corrected, a(16)-a(17) computed from A000849 by _Max Alekseyev_, Feb 21 2016
